member.summary: Determines how the associated property value will be generated by the underlying database.

member.summary: The list of options that the may have to indicate the way a property is generated.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Schema.DatabaseGeneratedOption.None
member.summary: None indicates the property is not database generated.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Schema.DatabaseGeneratedOption.Identity
member.summary: Identity indicates the value is generated on insert and remains unchanged on update.

member.name: F:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Schema.DatabaseGeneratedOption.Computed
member.summary: Computed indicates the value is generated on both insert and update.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceModel.DomainServices.LinqToSql.LinqToSqlDomainService`1.PersistChangeSet
member.summary: This method is called to finalize changes after all the operations in the specified changeset have been invoked. All changes are committed to the DataContext. If the submit fails due to concurrency conflicts will be called. If returns true a single resubmit will be attempted.
member.returns: Returns true if the was persisted successfully, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceModel.DomainServices.LinqToSql.LinqToSqlDomainService`1.ResolveConflicts(System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection)
member.summary: This method will be called if Submit fails due to optimistic concurrency conflicts. Override this method to handle optimistic concurrency conflicts. The base implementation returns false.
member.param: The collection of conflicts to resolve.
member.returns: True if all conflicts were resolved, false otherwise. If true is returned a resubmit will be attempted.

member.summary: Updates each entry in the ChangeSet with its corresponding conflict info.
member.param: Map of conflicts to their corresponding operations entries.
